title: The Best In Fashion On Bollywood Celebrity Instagram This Week
text:
facebook 
The week saw Anushka Sharma and Sonakshi Sinha (or their stylists) drawing definitive influences from Kim Kardashian’s Insta-winning style and Alia Bhatt giving us a quick lesson in easy-to-tackle Indian-wear. 
1.Sonam Kapoor debuted Payal Khandwala’s spring collection, contrasting a blue cape with a high-collar silk blouse and generously fitting white pants. Framing her celeb-jawline were poker-straight strands and statement earrings. A post shared by sonamkapoor (@sonamkapoor) on Mar 10, 2017 at 1:20am PST 
2.Alia Bhatt took on cool-girl Indian-wear in a billowy Payal Singhal tunic and a drop-crotch dhoti. With her snatched bun in place, this look was a refreshing change of pace from her twee dresses. ✨ A post shared by Alia ✨⭐️ (@aliaabhatt) on Mar 9, 2017 at 3:52am PST 
3.Talking about twee dresses, Kangana Ranaut emerged in this surprise of a number. Her Valentino dress, flanked by a cutesy collar, isn’t a typical sighting but it is one that we can absolutely get used to. A post shared by Ami Patel (@stylebyami) on Mar 4, 2017 at 9:32pm PST 
4.Kareena Kapoor gave a perfect demonstration of what royals wear on a night-out – a satin calf-grazing slip, topped with a metallic biker jacket, finished flawlessly with a pair of seriously deelish heels from Fendi. A post shared by Kareena Kapoor Khan FC (@kareenakapoorteam) on Mar 10, 2017 at 6:13pm PST 
5.Shilpa Shetty’s commitment to the seventies is strong in flared jeans and crop shirt, both by Dhruv Kapoor. Finishing out the look with her signature blowout and heavy lashes, the actress kept to the retro memo. A post shared by Sanjana Batra (@sanjanabatra) on Feb 26, 2017 at 12:11am PST 
6.Sonakshi Sinha pulled off a Kim K-in-her-legs-for-days, nude outfit. Pairing her neutral skirt set (featuring a micro wrap skirt and a long coat) with a tucked-in lace blouse, the actress was dressed to a perfect 10. Jewellery from Eina Ahluwalia, together with softly tousled hair, tied the list-topping look together. A post shared by Sonakshi Sinha (@aslisona) on Mar 6, 2017 at 10:56pm PST 
7.Also, inspired by the most famous Kardashian was Anushka Sharma’s layered outfit that featured a button-down bodycon and a languidly-fitting knee-grazing coat (Kareena’s maternity style, anyone?) Though, if it wasn’t for her white sneakers and lazy-girl half-tied hair, this look wouldn’t be half as interesting. A post shared by Allia Al Rufai (@alliaalrufai) on Mar 10, 2017 at 4:54am PST 
8.Lastly, as the only entrant on this list spotted in a sari, Vidya Balan stuck to her nine yards. Her black-and-gold sari was paired with traditional jhumkas and a last-minute bun. A post shared by Who Wore What When (@who_wore_what_when) on Mar 8, 2017 at 7:33pm PST
